Posted By: Hussalo (7/6/2013 3:15:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
So just played BRGu, splashing for [progenitor mimic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=progenitor mimic), this, and [blast of genius,](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=blast of genius,) most of the other cards were removal, [korozda gorgons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=korozda gorgons)... list here: http://tappedout.net/mtg-decks/rtr-brgu-combos/update/  
  
This was my first attempt at 4 colors in draft, it worked out pretty well, almost no mana screw in 6 matches. This guy was an absolute powerhouse. At one point, I had an opponent with 2 bird tokens and murmuring phantasm on the field, 20 life, me at 4 life, and him tapping the cyclops with hands of binding. I play [Mind Rot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Rot), pit fight making the cyclops kill the murmuring phantasm, then predator's rapport on the cyclops gaining 14 life. A few turns later, I cast horncaller's chant, the following turn, flesh & blood on the cyclops, flesh targeting a 3 power creature, bringing him to 7/7, dealing 7 to my opponent with blood, then swinging for lethal, for 24 damage that turn. I accidentally combo deck.
posts.html:

I play Mind Rot, pit fight making the cyclops kill the murmuring phantasm, then predator's rapport on the cyclops gaining 14 life. A few turns later, I cast horncaller's chant, the following turn, flesh & blood on the cyclops, flesh targeting a 3 power creature, bringing him to 7/7, dealing 7 to my opponent with blood, then swinging for lethal, for 24 damage that turn. I accidentally combo deck.

Posted By: ZeoStar (5/29/2013 2:22:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
One very important thing that I feel is missing here is the ability to attack without a power trigger. My favorite thing to do with a [Kiln Fiend](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kiln Fiend) is to attack unbuffed into a clearly superior defensive line and watch them let it through unblocked, terrified of [Fury Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fury Charm) or something - plinking the enemy to death with a 1/2 while I hold six lands in my hand. Or they try to [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) it and SURPRISE-I had two [Rune Snag](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rune Snag)s and now he's at +6/+0! \*WHAM\*  
  
With Nivix Cyclops, you have to give him a power boost before you can attack at all, so you kind of lose out on some of the bluffing fun. On the other hand, you gain the ability to [Pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyroclasm) the board and still attack, so it's really a clear case of your aggro-v-control requirements.
posts.html:
One very important thing that I feel is missing here is the ability to attack without a power trigger. My favorite thing to do with a Kiln Fiend is to attack unbuffed into a clearly superior defensive line and watch them let it through unblocked, terrified of Fury Charm or something - plinking the enemy to death with a 1/2 while I hold six lands in my hand. Or they try to Doom Blade it and SURPRISE-I had two Rune Snags and now he's at +6/+0! *WHAM*

With Nivix Cyclops, you have to give him a power boost before you can attack at all, so you kind of lose out on some of the bluffing fun. On the other hand, you gain the ability to Pyroclasm the board and still attack, so it's really a clear case of your aggro-v-control requirements.
